intro: Naucleopsis insculptula, commonly known as the narrow-leaf nauclea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by small, woody fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
